intro: Wunderlichia cruelsiana, commonly known as the red-flowered bellflower, is a striking plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by horticultural enthusiasts.
